title: Day 1274
content:
# Day 1274

Time spent with family is always a blessing. Tonight, Sloan, Paige, and myself enjoyed dinner at Sloan's great-grandparents' house. My grandmother still cooks the best steak, and what a gift it is to sit at the same table with the people who once raised my Dad.

Watching Sloan light up around her great-grandparents is something I'll never forget. She's such a bright little girl, and seeing her joy in that house fills me with gratitude.

I know this season won't last forever. One day she'll be a teenager who no longer asks me to hold her until she drifts off to sleep. The bedtime stories will fade into memories. That's inevitable. But right now, she still looks for me, still climbs into my lap, still wants me close.

Dear Lord, help me to cherish this fleeting time, to hold on to these ordinary yet extraordinary moments before they slip into the past.

Thank you for everything. Tonight was a great reminder that you can't be grateful and upset at the same time.

9/16/25

Conor Jay Chepenik
